metadata.Title: CVE-2021-36057 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
XMP Toolkit SDK version 2020.1 (and earlier) is affected by a write-what-where condition vulnerability caused during the application's memory allocation process. This may cause the memory management functions to become mismatched resulting in local application denial of service in the context of the current user.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-36057` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exempi - 2.4.5-2ubuntu0.1
libexempi3 - 2.4.5-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> fixed in adobe's 2021.07 code drop

criterions.comment: exempi package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.5-2ubuntu0.1').
